title: Compile time evaluation of several builtins wrongfully allows `decimal` arguments.
body:
### Version Information

* vyper Version (output of `vyper --version`): 0.3.9+commit.5c2892b2
* OS: OSX
* Python Version (output of `python --version`): 3.11.3

### What's your issue about?

The arguments of the following builtins are not well type-checked when they all are constant and the builtin is to be folded: (Should be `Int` AST nodes while the functions expect `Num` AST nodes):

- `uint256_addmod`
- `uint256_mulmod`
- `shift` (deprecated)
- `BitwiseAnd`, `BitwiseOr`, `BitwiseXor`, `BitwiseNot` (all deprecated)

For example, trying to compile the following contract will make the compiler panic:

```Vyper
@external
def foo():
    ds:uint256 = uint256_addmod(1.1,2.2,2)
```

This is an unhandled internal compiler error. Please create an issue on Github to notify the developers.
https://github.com/vyperlang/vyper/issues/new?template=bug.md

### How can it be fixed?

Replacing `vy_ast.Num` by `vy_ast.Int` in the `evaluate` method of the classes of the builtins should be enough.
